name: zem
text: She picks glasses for him that look exactly like her own

name: mockereo
text: I think she just sent him one of her pairs. Her insurance pays for a new pair of glasses every five years, but her style has not changed in over thirty years. Thus, extras that she hands down.

name: soticoto
text: I think she took them off and put them in a package instead of the glasses-case.

name: jhunt
text: It's like Ray just hides, waiting for his chance to impart bone-related knowledge.

name: belgand
text: If this is not how you currently live your life it is a false one and you should seek to change it.

name: zapatos
text: That's what she said.

name: belgand
text: Who, Sappho?

name: redmange
text:
No, your mother, who I...

...boned?!

name: overmedicated
text: Trying too hard, man.

name: doctorbeene
text: it's not like , it is .

name: nolley
text: This punch line is SO true.

name: boredom_man
text: Rubbish. What about the poor scribe who wrote that epic love poem and had to give King Solomon credit? He was all like, "Beams of cedar, Beams of cedar, Beams of cedar..."

name: abe
text: OH SNAP

name: mortshire
text: catullus is the utmost.

name: anomalous3
text: Catullus was the first poet who preferred boning women (though boys would do too)

name: belgand
text: Actually, Sappho pre-dates Catullus. So not quite.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: They pre-dated? How very peculiar.

name: belgand
text: Catullus' dactyls failed to meter her needs.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Bone-us, Bone-a, Bone-um.

name: chaesar
text: Capitalization of Bone enforces the essence of its power, little man. Bone.

name: catgrl131
text: A comment left by catgrl131 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by fakead, HSE, lux, aHatOfPig)

name: falala
text: Bone.

name: woodenteeth
text:
boNe

...damn it.

name: thehempfandango
text: Six times?

name: notcool
text: Booooone.

name: lacrimus
text: I have this taped on my notebook for my Catullus class.  He sure does get his bone on frequently.

name: deancain29
text: I never noticed Philippe's ears before. Im I alone?

name: badganjil
text: I emphasize with you. I hadn't noticed either.

name: max
text:
[IMGS OFF]

I butchered this way back in Latin 1 because I thought it would be fun. Now there is a place for my ungrammatical stylings.

name: sargasm
text: Wins for the "EXPELLENS"

name: wonelove
text: EXPELLENS

name: lacrimus
text: You have won the game!

name: stephanopoulos
text: A comment left by stephanopoulos was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zem, paul9, Madoushi)

name: nilehus
text: Damn you!

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Agh! I had forgotten I was playing the game, thus I was winning!

name: bixschmix
text:
God damn you! I had been winning for almost a year! And now because of you I just lost!

(Note to the innocent: Never begin playing The Game.)

name: zem
text: people are fucking retarded

name: notcool
text:
[IMGS OFF]

Thank you, XKCD

name: zem
text: get out of my inbox with this shit

name: notcool
text:
You are just sad and angry that your Assetbar efforts fall so flat.

Also, you don't know how to kiss anything without exchanging monies for it.

name: zem
text: hahaha where did that come from? who taught you to troll, your grandmother?

name: lawbot
text:
I feel that there must be a better way to translate Ray's speech. I KNOW there is no better way to translate "shove."

EXPELLENS!

name: zeal
text: Nice improvisation with oculos secundos for eyeglasses.

name: tbtabby
text: Congratulations. You have won at life. Unfortunately, now that you have won, you are ineligible for further participation and must be euthanized. Officials will arrive shortly to perform the euthanasia. Goodbye.

name: jdhenry105
text: Wins for "oculos secondos" for "eyeglasses."  Well done.

name: riazm
text: Mr Bear forgets that he is holding latin.

name: starman11
text: I wonder how many fruitless years of Latin Onstad took.

name: planetidiot
text: hell yes that is awesome

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Alt-text: "How do I know whats going on anymore?"  Im not sure if that's exact, because its from memory, because this is one of the best alt-texts ever.

name: zapatos
text: The a-t really does it for me here, you can almost taste his anxiety.

name: tetrisattack
text: Philippe looks like an old woman with those glasses.

name: kickstart
text: like on Seinfeld, when George accidentally bought "ladies' frames"

name: farqussus
text: when i was eight, mum let me choose some new sneakers. i chose wrong.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Have you....bought another pair since?

name: farqussus
text: I have, but to this day I spend an hour outside the shop manufacturing ways to ask if they are definitely guys shoes without actually asking.

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "How the fuck do I know what is happening any more?"

name: afronaut
text: Do you think Ray's mother and phillipes would ever be friends?

name: zeal
text: They're basically identical except that one is a cat and the other is a plush otter.

name: solobuttons
text: SHOVE

name: nutmeg
text: when Ray appeared with his bone-talk it occurred to me to cheer out loud, even at work.

name: scriblerus
text: I love many things about this strip, but mostly I love the way Ray shoves Cornelius out of the way in the last panel.  And that eyebrow.

name: honesttom
text: We think of boneworthy poets as beginning with Byron, but really the Romantic era owes a great deal to the foundations laid by Catullus.

name: fineoakstructure
text: That guy laid foundations? He was insatiable.

name: rowboat
text: Try as they may, this is all lost on Philippe.

name: thatcrazycommie
text: Oh, snap! This is like my fourth trip through the archives and I just realized that Ray is pushing Cornelius out of the way, not, as I thought, suddenly removing his full-body Cornelius suit. Imagine it that way.

name: paperboy_2000
text: That is a hilarious interpretation!  But I could see Ray doing that to Pat.  Maybe disguising himself as the mailman to drop in a few "bone-bone-bones!" before Pat knew what hit him.

name: fosters
text:
"Well Mr. Reynolds, here's your latest Outraged Vegan newsletter and this month's edition of Reasonable Man Monthly. Speaking of which, have I told you about that reasonable man THAT I BONED? BONE BONE BONE! Uhn! Uhn!"

"God DAMN it, Ray."

name: professorhazard
text: Ray shoving Cornelius out of the way metaphorically represents the cats taking over as the lead characters of Achewood.

name: notcool
text: Professor, this is the most enlightened statement that I have read so far on the Assetbar. As such, you recieve my first chubby. I hope you're suitably proud of it. I sure am.

name: i_love_kate
text: Congratulations, Prof. Hazard. You just took Notcool's cherry.

name: niraj
text: I have a Latin Literature class that I'm taking this semester. The teacher showed the reading list and Catullus was on it. I instantly started laughing my ass off

name: lux
text: that was a pretty extreme reaction to his name right there

name: yomimono
text: Did you have to explain yourself?  If so, how did that go?

name: niraj
text: No, he either didn't care or didn't notice. He was kind of spazzy

name: zem
text: glass house

name: helmstreet
text:
Just looking through some old comics, and I was shocked that no one posted this yet:
Pedicabo ego uos et irrvmabo, meritriculae!

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes, we really dropped the ball on that, as a community.

name: tekende
text: No, no, I'm sorry! None of those words mean anything to me!

name: lux
text: Acmen Septimius suos amores tenens in gremio... if you know what I mean

name: prettyrad
text: Yesterday, I was showing my girlfriend a book of Marilyn Hacker's poems, particularly the bits with lesbian sex. (Yeah.) She asked if I'd heard of Catullus, and I started off, "Catullus was the first poet who ever got... Yeah, I know of Catallus."

name: deusoma
text: Probably a wise choice.

name: bizarro8mybaby
text: Cornelius and Ray must have staged this.  It is highly unlikely that Ray is familiar with the works of Catullus.

name: echidnaboy
text: Ray makes a point of familiarising himself with all pioneers in the field of getting one's Bone on.

name: drizzleforizzle
text: I love the onomatopoeia of "shove"

name: zapatos
text: It is perfect.
